page.title: 03Bells Haulage Firm
page.content: One of the haulage firms at Barrington is 66 years old and it started at Ashington in 1919. They have 25 wagons and 6o trailers. On the wagons it has "Bells of Ashington". About 35 people work for Mr Bell, 2O of the people drive the wagons, 4 people maintain the engines and the bodywork of the wagons. The wagons are bought when they are brand new and sold when they are 5 or 6 years old. The trailers are attached to the wagon by a 2" pin, there are also wires attached to make the lights work. Each trailer has a number so the drivers know which trailer to connect to his wagon. The goods they carry are taken all over the Country. There are computers in the office which store information about the wagons.
